text: Albrecht Kossel (16 September 1853 â€“ 5 July 1927) was a German doctor. He won the 1910 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, for his work on proteins and nucleic substances. He discovered histones, which package and regulate DNA transcription. == References == Category:1853 births Category:1927 deaths Category:German doctors Category:German Nobel Prize winners Category:People from Rostock
title: Albrecht Kossel
